page.title: 01THE SURVEYED AREA - HEREFORD
page.content: The surveyed area includes the eastern outskirts of the City of Hereford, the village of Lugwardine and parts of the villages of Withington and Shellwick. It is dominated by the flood plain of the River Lugg, known locally as the Lugg Flats and the land rises steeply to the east and west. The flats may be flooded twice or thrice a year following heavy rain or snow and vast flocks of ducks and geese are attracted from the Severn Estuary. Cattle make use of the fertile natural pastures when conditions are suitable. Population pressure has resulted in virtually all of the building land within the City to be developed. Elsewhere the emphasis is on agriculture with cattle and grain being important.
